item.title: Principle of implementation of atomic operations
item.description: 1. Introduction Atomic means “the smallest particle that cannot be further divided”, and atomic operation means “an operation or series of operations that cannot be interrupted”. Implementing atomic operations on a multiprocessor becomes a bit complicated. In this article, let’s talk about how atomic operations are implemented on Intel processors and in Java. 2. Definition of Terms Compare and Swap CAS operations require two values to be entered, an old value (the value before the desired operation) and a new value, during which the old value is compared to the new value if it has not changed, and not exchanged if it.
